title: Domain RDAP Lookup
subtitle: Query domain registration data using RDAP (Registration Data Access Protocol). RDAP is the modern successor to WHOIS, providing structured JSON responses through IANA bootstrap registry routing.

example.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for example.com (Example domain for testing)

google.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for google.com (Popular domain with comprehensive records)

github.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for github.com (Tech company domain)

stackoverflow.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for stackoverflow.com (Community platform domain)

cloudflare.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for cloudflare.com (CDN provider domain)

iana.tooltip: Perform RDAP lookup for iana.org (Internet registry domain)

form.title: RDAP Lookup Configuration
form.domainTooltip: Enter a domain name to query registration data via RDAP

results.title: RDAP Data for {domain}
results.domainTooltip: The domain name that was queried
results.rdapServiceTooltip: RDAP service used for the query

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Tips:
troubleshooting.validDomain: Ensure the domain name is valid and properly formatted
troubleshooting.domainExists: Check if the domain actually exists and is registered
troubleshooting.rateLimiting: Some registries may have rate limiting or access restrictions
troubleshooting.tryAgain: Try again in a few moments if the service is temporarily unavailable

whatIsRDAP.title: What is RDAP?
whatIsRDAP.description: RDAP (Registration Data Access Protocol) is the modern successor to WHOIS, providing structured JSON responses for domain registration information through IANA bootstrap registry routing.

rdapVsWhois.title: RDAP vs WHOIS
rdapVsWhois.structuredJSON: Structured JSON instead of free text
rdapVsWhois.rateLimiting: Built-in rate limiting and privacy controls
rdapVsWhois.restfulAPI: RESTful API with standard HTTP methods
